summary: U.S. military commanders have a wide range of legal responsibilities. Commanders, for example, have legal authority to discipline personnel under the military system of justice and need to comply with international law and rules of engagement. They receive legal training throughout their careers. However, we found the relevant military databases did not include all training. Training provider records showed higher participation than service databases. We...
title: Military Training: The Services Need to Ensure That All Commanders Are Prepared for Their Legal Responsibilities
